      • executorCommandArgs

        public static java.lang.String[] executorCommandArgs​(Config config,
                                                     Config runtime,
                                                     java.util.Map<SchedulerUtils.ExecutorPort,​java.lang.String> ports,
                                                     java.lang.String containerIndex)
        Util method to get the arguments to the heron executor. This method creates the arguments without the container index, which is the first argument to the executor
        Parameters:
        config - The static Config
        runtime - The runtime Config
        ports - a map of ports to use where the key indicate the port type and the value is the port
        containerIndex - The index of the current container
        Returns:
        String[] representing the arguments to start heron-executor

      • encodeJavaOpts

        public static java.lang.String encodeJavaOpts​(java.lang.String javaOpts)
        Encode the JVM options
        1. Convert it into Base64 format
        2. Add \" at the start and at the end
        3. replace "=" with "(61)" and "&equals;" '=' can be parsed in a wrong way by some schedulers (aurora) hence it needs to be escaped.
        Returns:
        encoded string

      • decodeJavaOpts

        public static java.lang.String decodeJavaOpts​(java.lang.String encodedJavaOpts)
        Decode the JVM options
        1. strip \" at the start and at the end
        2. replace "(61)" and "&equals;" with "="
        3. Revert from Base64 format Note that '=' is escaped in two different ways. '(61)' is the new escaping. '&equals;' was the original replacement but it is not friendly to bash and was causing issues. The original escaping is still left there for reference and backward compatibility purposes (to be removed after no topology needs it)
        Returns:
        decoded string

      • createOrCleanDirectory

        public static boolean createOrCleanDirectory​(java.lang.String directory)
        Create the directory if it does not exist otherwise clean the directory.
        Parameters:
        directory - the working directory to setup
        Returns:
        true if successful

      • curlAndExtractPackage

        public static boolean curlAndExtractPackage​(java.lang.String workingDirectory,
                                            java.lang.String packageURI,
                                            java.lang.String packageDestination,
                                            boolean isDeletePackage,
                                            boolean isVerbose)
        Curl a package, extract it to working directory
        Parameters:
        workingDirectory - the working directory to setup
        packageURI - the URL of core release package
        packageDestination - the destination of the core release package fetched
        isDeletePackage - delete the package curled or not
        isVerbose - display verbose output or not
        Returns:
        true if successful
